title: For Sale/Trade:  Taurus PT-22 Nickel with Rosewood Grips, 2 Mags, Holster
location: I Live in London, work in Columbus., Columbus, Ohio
postcontent:
For sale is a "like-new" Taurus PT-22 pistol.  Included are an extra magazine (two total), original box and papers, and a Passport brand belt holster.

The gun is nickel with Rosewood grips.  Both magazines are OEM Taurus.  The holster is a nylon Passport which can work for right or left hand carry.  I have carried this gun several times myself and really like the Passport holster.

A female customer bought this gun, against my advice, for concealed carry.  After a week she brought it back and bought a revolver (my original advice).  
This gun has had less than 50 rounds fired through it ( Iknow this because she brought the original box of ammo back with the gun, with maybe 20 rounds used).  It is very clean and like new.  

The barrel tips up for easy loading of the first round, which makes it an ideal choice for ladies who don't like to pull the slide back to chamber the first round.  

The PT-22 is single action only with an internal hammer.  Very safe to carry fully loaded.  

I am a dealer, so can ship to any other dealer after I get a copy of their FFL.  If you live in Ohio and want to meet me I can do that, but will still have to complet the 4473 and call in the background check.

Shipping is a flat $25 to anywhere in the US.

I WILL consider trades, here is what I am looking for:
1) A stainless 357 mag, with adjustable sights and at least a 6" barrel
2) Ruger MKII 22 stainless, with adjustable sights and at least a 5" barrel.

Payment must be received via Postal money order, certified check, or cashiers check before I will ship.  SORRY, I DO NOT ACCEPT CHECKS OR PAYPAL.

Feel free to email with questions.  If you include a phone number I will return a call to you.

Thanks.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Danish Krag
postcontent:
Got this cut down Krag and it just doesn't fit into my collection. I'm not too familiar with these rifles so feel free to ask questions or get me to take more pictures of certain areas.

Rifle has a Lyman 57WJS rear sight on it and a dovetailed blade front sight with a small brass or copper insert. On the top of the receiver are the markings C.L.S. I am not sure what they stand for. The bolt may or may not have been bent back a bit, I just don't know what bolts came with what models. All the metal parts I can see match the receiver though.

The stock is in less than great shape just because of how many modifications were attempted. A pistol grip was added and screwed and glued on. Looks like doing so cracked the wrist area and there is a brass rod going though. It was either to reinforce it, or was the original problem. The rifle has a decelerator pad added and is missing the sling swivels.

Overall it has a few problems but should be a good source of hard to find parts or at least a sporter if you wanted to rebarrel it. I think it is currently in the original caliber of 8x58r.

Again, ask any questions if I'm leaving something out.

title: For Sale:  Mauser 91 Argentine Rifle 7.65mm sporterized
postcontent:
(In the picture with two rifles it's the one on the right)

I'm selling a mildly sporterized 7.65mm Argentine M91 Mauser rifle. It was made in Berlin, Germany by DWM, under contract for the Argentine military. If you're not familiar with old Mausers, this is a bolt-action rifle with a top loading, 5-round, non-removable magazine, and adjustable iron sights.

Years ago when these Argentines were first imported in large numbers, it was common for folks to "sporterize" them by curving down the bolt handle and reshaping the clunky military stock to a more sporting profile. That's exactly what was done to this one. The barrel, receiver and action have not been modified.

The rifle shoots well and the bolt draw is super smooth. Overall it's in uncommonly nice condition for an ex-military gun that's 100+ years old. Yes, there are an assortment of small marks and surface scratches in the finish, but nothing out of the ordinary for a gun that's been taken good care of for most of its long life. The bore has nice strong rifling with some dark patches -- much better than average for its age but certainly not minty fresh either. The stock is a beautiful tiger-stripe maple, one of the prettiest I've seen on any Mauser. I just haven't been using this gun and would rather turn it into cash or something I would use more often.

In the pictures below it's the rifle on the right (the ugly one the left is already gone).

The receiver stamp says MAUSER MODELO ARGENTINO 1891 DEUTSCHE WAFFEN UND MUNITIONSFABRIKEN BERLIN.

Asking price: $175 ?

Possible trades: .22 rifle, pump shotgun, handguns of all kinds, inexpensive single-shot rifle (NEF, H&R, Rossi, Rem Spartan, etc.), or some boxes of ammo in common handgun calibers (.357mag, .38spl, .380acp, .44mag, .45acp, or 9mm). Other trades possible if it's something of value to me. If you're not sure, just throw it out there. Worst I can say is 'no thanks.'

I also have 100+ rounds of surplus FMJ 7.65 ammo that can go with the rifle for a few extra $ or the right trade.

Face to face deal in Corvallis, Oregon. Private party. All the usual conditions apply (must be an Oregon resident of legal age, etc.)

title: For Sale:  Kel-Tech PLR16's Pre-Order Special!  223/556 !!
postcontent:
Buck Shot Sporting Goods just ordered these and they will be arriving next week and will be ready for pickup!  Get yours reserved today while they last.  Price is before tax.  Shipping available to your local FFL.  Here are some specs on the pistol: 

The PLR-16 is a gas operated, semi-automatic pistol chambered in 5.56 mm NATO caliber. It was designed as and is intended as a long-range target and hunting pistol. 
The PLR-16 has a conventional gas piston operation and utilizes the proven M-16 breech locking system. The rear sight is adjustable for windage. The front sight is of M-16 type. An integrated MIL-STD-1913 Picatinny rail will accept a multitude of standard accessories. The muzzle end of the barrel is threaded 1/2” -28 to accept standard attachments such as a muzzle brake. Except for the barrel, bolt, sights, and mechanism, the PLR-16 pistol is made entirely of high-impact glass fiber reinforced polymer. 
The PLR-16 pistol comes blued, with one 10 round magazine (fully AR15/M16 magazine compatible), and includes a gun lock. 

Technical Specifications
Caliber: .223 rem 5.56mm NATO 
Weight unloaded (no magazine): 51 oz 1450 g 
Length: 18.5" 470 mm 
Barrel length: 9.2" 234 mm 
Sight radius: 12.5" 318 mm

Browning BDM, 9mm, very good condition, with box and two 15 rd mags.

The Browning BDM was developed in 1991 by the Browning Arms Company, and unlike Browning's (FN Herstal) P-35 Hi-Power model, was manufactured only in North America.

The pistol is a magazine fed, self-loading, hammer firing type which was designed with a trigger "mode" switch installed on the left-hand side of the slide (actually only a flush inlaid disk with a bisecting groove), toggling between double-action/single-action(DA/SA) pistol mode, and the double-action-only (DAO)

title: For Sale:  US Property Marked Smith & Wesson Victory Model .38 S&W, World War 2 Vintage
postcontent:
Australian issue Lend-Lease .38 S&W Pre-Victory /Victory Model (M&P), Military & Police revolver issued between 1942-1945. Parkerized finish. United States Property Marked. W.B. (Waldemar Bromberg) and Ordnance bomb inspection proofs on butt as well as P proof marking. The side of frame beneath cylinder shows full complement of English / Australian proofmarks. All matching serial numbers on barrel, cylinder, extractor star, and butt. The crane and crane recess are numbered to one another, but different from the serial number, which is correct for ALL Victory models. Bore is shiny. Case hardening on trigger and hammer is very nice. Comes with numbered kraft type box with Smith & Wesson manual outlining the specs and history of this particular model.

This gun was part of the Estate of Joe (now deceased) & Brian Buffer, father and brother respectively of Bruce and Michael Buffer - ring announcers for Pro-Boxing and UFC.

Own a rare and ironic piece of history. The Australians fought alongside US GI's to gain their freedom from tyranny in WWII, only to not be able to own guns in the late 20th and now 21st Century for self-defense. Only 8000 of these were exported to Australia during WW2.

Buyer must meet Seller at local FFL dealer to perform Private Party Transfer/ CA DROS (Dealer Record of Sale).  Buyer is responsible for all transfer fees.

title: For Sale/Trade:  PSL 7.62x54R Marksman Rifle ( FPK, Dragunov, Romak 3 )
postcontent:
------------IF PICTURES ARE SMALL, REFRESH PAGE TO ENLARGE THEM---------------
$2000 non negotiable (with the new gasblock) or 1800 without. I know this is expensive, and it is not for everyone. But if you want a semi auto sniper rifle that is capable of what this is then it is a fair price.

Keep in mind this has a 2 stage match trigger, best hand new picked and slugged/aligned  barrel I could find with matching #kit, 10 degree crown, best of 20 1p21 scopes 




This is a prototype weapon I built,,,it is still not serial #ed but will serial # it before I send it off with you. 

I can give this a custom serial # and/or a custom model # of your choice.
Yes.....I can do that, I am a firearm manufacturer. I will electro etch everything in and can do a custom design/insignia around the serial area if you like.


This reciever started out as a full piece of 4ft x 8 ft flat steel that was, cut out bent, pressed, indented, machined down, welded, and hardended.

This reciever was completely made by me,,,not a 80% that was finished, or a store bought piece, I can show you my dies and custom tooling for making these receivers.

The rest of the gun is like new military demil parts kit, with matching numbers, threaded barrel, and the infamus safety detent sear kit that you never see with these guns when they come in with the third axis pin. Which is not illeagal to posess but once installed this becomes a NFA "class three" weapon by ATF standard.

The scope is a 1p21 sniper scope, it was designed for use on a machine gun, but the snipers found it to be a great scope and adopted it so. It is an auto auto ranging scope to automatically compensate for bullet drop from 300 meters to 1300 meters (about .8 miles.) This scope lets you shoot 200-300 meters, and if aquire a target @ 600 meters, you just turn the zoom to 6, and you are zeroed in automatically. then if you see another target @ 1300 meters you turn your scope to 9 (for 900 meters) and use your lowest chevron and you are automaticaly zeroed @ 1300 and ready to fire. You can zoom it back out to 300 and you are automatically zeroed back it.

With this scope you can only use 1 type of bullet,,,a 149-152 grain bullet with the same ballistic coefficient as the 7n1 sniper ammo. 


(keep in mind that 7n1 and 7n14(AP) ammo just surplus ammo with better quality control and care and a bit of inner changes (added air pocket) ,,,,nothing extremely special about it. I had some ammo custom handloaded special for this gun,,,,I have spent alot of time and money finding and having my reloader make these custom rounds for me.


These make the 7n1 look like basic surplus junk! This ammo is very accurate after months and months of playing with bullets and powders we found a combo that is a perfect match for this barrel and scope, @ 300, 600, 900  and 1300 meters. @ 1300 metes I can hold 3 shot groups in a 24" pattern, on a cool calm day from a viced lead sled. That is very good for a semi auto thin barrel rifle, and a 150+/- grain bullet!

comes with 4 magazines, and 100 rounds of ammo,  and a muzzle brake that cuts the recoil down in half of what it is with the muzzle brake in the pic. Works really well, just looks big and ugly.
REDACTED


Also I am just about finished with my own adjustable gas block, turning this into a bolt action, and with the flip of a switch, back to a semi auto. That should help the accuracy even more.

when it is finished I will want $200 more with the new gasblock,,,well because this gas block looks cool, and it is either on or off,,,not using a set screw like the cheap $100 ones found on the net that look like a big gaudy Klondike bar sitting on your barrel.

I have a second version of this in the works now that will shoot a .308 bullet and have (about) the same bullet drop as the .311 762x54r bullet now used. This next rifle will have the fast switch adjustable gas block installed and have a 26" 1" fluted bull barrel. Taking up alot of time and money, so the funds from this gun will go to making that one. 

that should cover it,,,any questions please call. Also serious buys can view a shoot with this gun,,,,,I have 300, 900 and 1300 meter targets set up on my property in Morganton on the top of the mountain. We can go, set up the targets, I will shoot and you can see what this rifle can do. SERIOUS BUYERS ONLY!

This puppy will outshoot my dragunov all day, for half the price!LOL

title: For Sale:  1954 Belgian Browning A5 16 gauge standard
postcontent:
This 1954 Browning A5 (Belgian made) is in great condition, both mechanically and cosmetically. I'd put the bluing at 97% and the wood at 90%. It is a standard, and NOT a sweet 16. All numbers match.

Stock & forend are in great shape with handling marks and slight lacquer wear. The stock still retains its original integrity, with NO splits or cracks. 

Overall, it's in great condition for an older gun. The barrel is 28” in length, is chambered for 2.75” shells, has a solid rib and a fixed FULL choke. The underside of the barrel has a rub spot, as most of these models do. 

The gun is in excellent mechanical condition and shoots great. I'm not interested in trades at the moment, unless you have a similar Browning automatic in a 12 gauge or a Beretta 390 synthetic.

The Browning BDM was developed in 1991 by the Browning Arms Company, and unlike Browning's (FN Herstal) P-35 Hi-Power model, was manufactured only in North America.

title: For Sale:  Project Appleseed Rifle Marksmanship Clinic
postcontent:
Project Appleseed Rifle Marksmanship Clinic
When:
October 29-30, 2011.  Event starts at 08:30 AM.

Where:
Hillside Plinkers Range
2676 Browns Creek Rd.
Williamsburg, KY 40769
N36.78239 W84.09265

This event is open to everyone.  Project Appleseed is an activity of The Revolutionary War Veterans Association, a 501(c)(3) all volunteer, non-political, non-profit organization, dedicated to teaching every American our shared heritage and history as well as traditional rifle marksmanship skills.  You may shoot anything from a .22 rimfire (the Ruger 10/22 and Marlin 795 are popular) to a centerfire such as an AR, AK, SKS, M1A or M1.  You will shoot approximately 250 rounds per day as you try to qualify as a Rifleman (210 Points) on a modified version of the AQT (Army Qualification Test) course of fire.

There are only 20 slots open for this clinic, so pre-registration is highly encouraged to make sure a spot on the line is reserved for you.  Politics are not discussed at Appleseed shoots, except for the politics of 1775.  NOTE: Participation in an Appleseed shoot meets the marksmanship requirement of the Civilian Marksmanship Program to purchase a vintage "US Rifle, Cal. .30, M1" (aka "Garand rifle") at a DEEP discount.  The Revolutionary War Veterans Association (RWVA) is a CMP affiliated organization.

Some of the things you will learn-
Safe Rifle Handling
The Six Steps to Firing the Shot
Building Solid Shooting Positions; Standing, Sitting and Prone.
Steady Hold Factors
Use of the GI Web Sling
Natural Point of Aim
Inches, Minutes and Clicks
The Story of Our Nation’s Birth
The Lessons of April 19, 1775
The Debt We Owe to Our Forefathers
The Duty We Owe to Our Posterity

Pre-registration Fees (per person):
Active Military, Reserve, and Guard (w/ ID), Peace Officers (w/ ID), Disabled (w/ ID), Re-enactors in period dress, Elected officials (w/proof) shoot for free!
Youth (Under 21): $2.50 for one day or $5 for both days.
Women: $5 for one day or $10 for both days.
All others: $45 for one day or $70 for both days.
Hillside Plinkers Range Fee: $5 per adult shooter

Learn More, Find Directions and Register at:
http://www.appleseedinfo.org/search-states.php?filter=KY&statename=Kentucky

Our state Facebook page:
http://www.facebook.com/KentuckyRifleman

Rifles and ammunition are not supplied.
Attendees are responsible for determining applicable firearms laws of the host state and for travel.
Sponsored by the Revolutionary War Veterans Association, a 501(c)(3) organization

I would be happy to answer any questions you have about the specifics of an Appleseed event.

Do you know when and where the American Revolution began? (It's not what you've been taught in school), Do you know where the War of Independence started? (It's not where you think).  Want to learn about the events of April 18-19, 1775?  Want to learn the fundamentals of rifle marksmanship taught by the best instructors in the nation?  Attend a Project Appleseed Rifle Marksmanship and Heritage clinic!  Kentucky schedule:
